Class UserUtilities

java.lang.Object
UserUtilities
public class UserUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains methods for banking functions
Author:
David Morales

  • Constructor Details

    • UserUtilities

      public UserUtilities()

  • Method Details

    • accountNumSearch

      public static Customer accountNumSearch​(int accountType)
      This method searches for bank user accounts using account number in the hashmaps (three hashmaps for each type of account), and returns the user found. Returns null if no user is found.
      Parameters:
      accountType - The account type the user is searching for. Serves as an index to get the specific hash map from hashMapAccountNums.
      Returns:
      The found user.

    • accountNameSearchForReader

      public static Customer accountNameSearchForReader​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName)
      This method is for name search for transactionReader.
      Parameters:
      firstName - User's first name
      lastName - user's last name
      Returns:
      returns found user

    • accountNameSearch

      public static Customer accountNameSearch()
      This method searches for accounts by name. It uses linear search O(n) to find the bank user. This is the slow search.
      Returns:
      Found user

    • userInputInteger

      public static int userInputInteger​(int rangeLimit)
      This is user input validation for selecting options on the menu.
      Parameters:
      rangeLimit - This ensures a specific range of numbers allowed for user input
      Returns:
      Returns converted string to int.

    • userInputDouble

      public static double userInputDouble()
      This method does input validation for double values (when user inputs money)
      Returns:
      Returns converted string into double

    • fileReader

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Customer> fileReader() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      This method reads bank user(s) info from a .csv file, creates objects, and adds them into a array list.
      Returns:
      An arrayList of all bank user objects
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
      java.io.IOException

    • findMaxValue

      public static int findMaxValue​(int oldNum, int newNum)
      A simple method to replace a lower value with a higher value.
      Parameters:
      oldNum - Older number to be compared to
      newNum - Newer number to be compared to
      Returns:
      returns higher value

    • transactionReader

      public static void transactionReader() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      This method reads the transaction file and with the use of switch cases statements, it directs the information to execute commands in the banking system.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
      java.io.IOException

    • dynamicParser

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> dynamicParser​(java.lang.String[] headerString)
      This method gets the bank user list and gets specific indexes in the csv file
      Parameters:
      headerString - Takes the tokenized header string from the csv
      Returns:
      A hashmap has strings as keys, and specific indexes where they correlate.

    • fileParser

      public static java.lang.String[] fileParser​(java.lang.String strLine, int numOfElements)
      This method parses the textfile line by line to remove unwanted characters from the string.
      Parameters:
      strLine - A unparsed string (a whole line from the .csv)
      numOfElements - The number (int) of elements that would be parsed from the file
      Returns:
      Returns tokenized string

    • idNumParser

      public static int idNumParser​(java.lang.String strIdNum)
      This method parses id number from the textfile and returns the integer representation
      Parameters:
      strIdNum - String version of ID numbers
      Returns:
      Returns a parsed (String to int) ID number

    • printUsers

      public static void printUsers​(java.util.ArrayList<Customer> bankUsers)
      Prints all users for the menu.
      Parameters:
      bankUsers - This arrayList contains all bank users (Customer)

    • updateDatabase

      public static void updateDatabase​(java.util.ArrayList<Customer> bankUserList) throws java.io.IOException
      Rewrites the .csv with updated information
      Parameters:
      bankUserList - The arrayList of all bank users and their attributes/info
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • isInputValid

      public static boolean isInputValid​(java.lang.String input)
      Checks if string input are numbers using try/catch exceptions.
      Parameters:
      input - The user inputted String
      Returns:
      Returns true if string is a number

    • isInputValidDouble

      public static boolean isInputValidDouble​(java.lang.String input)
      Checks if string input are double numbers using try/catch exceptions.
      Parameters:
      input - The user inputted String
      Returns:
      Returns true if string a number

    • passwordChecker

      public static boolean passwordChecker​(Customer bankUser)
      Checks user password using a string comparison.
      Parameters:
      bankUser - The bank user account.
      Returns:
      Returns true or false about the user's password.

    • transactionLogger

      public static void transactionLogger​(java.lang.String transaction) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes to a separate text file to log all transactions of the session
      Parameters:
      transaction - The string that gets written to transactionLog.txt
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
